snippet: The National Gallery in London has purchased its first major American painting, George Bellows’s “Men of the Docks,” for $25.5 million.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; National Gallery in London purchases its first major American painting, George Bellows’s Men of the Docks, for $25.5 million; examples of American Folk Art Museum's prized collection will be subject of traveling exhibition; Japan Society gives $6 million to Odawara Art Foundation; New York real estate developer Edward J Minskoff displays work by artist Jeff Koons in lobby of 51 Astor Place.
lead_paragraph: The National Gallery in London has purchased its first major American painting, George Bellows’s “Men of the Docks,” for $25.5 million.

headline.main: A Bellows Painting Moves From Virginia to London
headline.print_headline: A Bellows Painting Moves From Virginia to London
